intro: Triplaris venezoelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan triplaris, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten by birds and small mammals, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests and is often found in the understory layer of the canopy.
